issue.title: update docs for support hashes for rclone hashum

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
<!--

Welcome :-)

So you've got an idea to improve rclone? We love that! You'll be glad to hear we've incorporated hundreds of ideas from contributors already.

Here is a checklist of things to do:

  1. Please search the old issues first for your idea and +1 or comment on an existing issue if possible.
  2. Discuss on the forum first: https://forum.rclone.org/
  3. Make a feature request issue (this is the right place!).
  4. Be prepared to get involved making the feature :-)

Looking forward to your great idea!

The Rclone Developers

-->


#### What is your current rclone version (output from `rclone version`)?
rclone v1.53.3
- os/arch: windows/amd64
- go version: go1.15.5

#### What problem are you are trying to solve?
the documentation needs to be update for the supported hashes for command `hashsum`
 https://rclone.org/commands/rclone_hashsum/#synopsis
from 
```
Supported hashes are:
  * MD5
  * SHA-1
  * DropboxHash
  * QuickXorHash
```
to match the output of `rclone hashsum` command

```
rclone hashsum
Supported hashes are:
  * MD5
  * SHA-1
  * Whirlpool
  * CRC-32
  * DropboxHash
  * MailruHash
  * QuickXorHash
```

#### How do you think rclone should be changed to solve that?
update the documenation
thanks

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
### What is the purpose of this change?

Implement the `rclone bisync` command (port of [rclonesync](https://github.com/cjnaz/rclonesync-V2))

#### Was the change discussed in an issue or in the forum before?

Fixes #118

#### Checklist

- [x] I have read the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#submitting-a-pull-request).
- [x] I have added tests for all changes in this PR if appropriate.
- [x] I have added documentation for the changes if appropriate.
- [x] All commit messages are in [house style](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit-messages).
- [x] I'm done, this Pull Request is ready for review :-Q

### Action Items

- [x] Core functionality, first sync and dry run modes
- [x] Access health check
- [x] Filters file MD5 validation
- [x] Test engine for original test scenarios
- [x] Honor `--max-delete` flag
- [x] API endpoint `sync/bisync`
- [x] Basic test (`test_basic`) passes
- [x] Draft documentation
- [x] Really compare console logs
- [x] Make first-sync and dry-run tests pass
- [x] Implement ABORT/CRITICAL logic
- [x] Compatibility with `--legacy` messages and tests
- [x] Port README.md and TESTING.md
- [x] All tests pass on Local FS
- [x] All tests pass with Google Drive
- [x] All tests pass with Dropbox
- [x] Tests run and pass on Windows
- [x] Fix tests for Mailru
- [x] Fix tests for FTP (depends on #5283)
- [x] Fix tests for SFTP
- [x] Fix tests for AWS S3
- [x] Fix tests for Chunker/LocalFs (depends on #5297)
- [x] Put verbosity of bisync messages under control
- [x] Develop legacy free syntax for test scenarios
- [x] Keep hash in listings, if available (don't use for sync yet). See [rclonesync#5](https://github.com/cjnaz/rclonesync-V2/issues/5)
- [x] Parallelize all list/copy/delete operations for performance
- [x] Drop legacy support as soon as we are fully decoupled from the original project
- [x] Gracefully handle invalid UTF-8 in filenames. ([rcsync#62](https://github.com/cjnaz/rclonesync-V2/issues/62))
- [x] Handle files that change during a bisync run - _documented_ ([rcsync#24](https://github.com/cjnaz/rclonesync-V2/issues/24))
- [x] Fix remaining FIXMEs
- [x] Add original license, author and attributions
- [x] More docs: FILTERING.md, USAGE.md, TROUBLESHOOTING.md
- [x] Inventory bug reports from the original project

issue.title: fs/hash: align hashsum names and update documentation

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
#### What is the purpose of this change?

Spelling of hash names in rclone is rather unusual.
`SHA-1` contains dash while `MD5` and `CRC32` don't. All three are upper case.
In the same time `DropboxHash` and `MailruHash` carry the `Hash` suffix and use camel case,
while `Whirlpool` doesn't have the suffix.

Keeping this in mind can be problematic for average user.
The `hashsum` command won't print the correct spelling if you make a mistake.
It does help you if you run it without arguments, but the help message will miss a few hashes.

This pull request seeks to:
1. Unify all hashsum names as
    **lower case alphanumeric words without punctuation**:
    `rclone hashsum sha1 ...`, `crc32`, `quickxor`, etc
2. Accept legacy names as aliases so existing rclone wrappers continue to work.
    They can be used but disappear from documentation from now on.
    Probably a depreciation warning could be printed but I'd rather leave it for a later PR.
3. Make `rclone hashsum` print supported hash list in case of:
    (a) wrong hash name spelling (b) no arguments (h) --help
4. Keep documentation up-to-date
5. Replace O(N) list lookups in `fs/hash/hash.go` by O(1) map lookups.
    Not a massive performance improvement but makes code look better.

There is one more item that could have been done, but I need advice:

6. Ignore case of hash names supplied by user so that upper-case or
    mixed-case would be accepted too (lower-case still being canonical),
    e.g. `rclone hashsum SHA1 ...` or `DropBox`.

#### Was the change discussed in an issue or in the forum before?

Fixes #5071 
Fixes #4841

#### Checklist

- [x] I have read the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#submitting-a-pull-request).
- [x] I have added tests for all changes in this PR if appropriate.
- [x] I have added documentation for the changes if appropriate.
- [x] All commit messages are in [house style](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit-messages).
- [x] I'm done, this Pull Request is ready for review :-O
